entry.title: Update
entry.content:
I have been working through the assignments. Nothing seems too bad so far, got a blast of excitement though when i started into data mining web sites. It gave me an idea for my first side project: 

mine user data from a site to identify % of users who are spammers, and display their names

step 1: be able to specify for 1 website all users who have posted recently (last 90 days). display to terminal
step 2: present information on a website
step 3a: be able to investigate new websites, (how to automate data mining based on user information)
step 3b: work on algorithm to improve linkage
step 3c: improve system user intuition to link to new sites and way they store user information (may require user login)

With great power comes great responsibility…

Until next time

entry.title: First Blog Post
entry.content:
Topic of the day: Why I started programming?

I first started learning programming in high school. I enjoyed solving problems, and had a blast until I got to the de-bugging, which routinely took twice as long as writing the logic and program. I decided to try out physics, as it had to be more intuitive, right? Fast forward to college, and I was in the same rabbit hole with strength of materials and fluid flows. I ended up having a blast, but that assumption was debunked.

After college i decided to build a 3d printer, the PWDR printer. This was basically the first attempt from a group of european students, and it showed… As I got into the arduino coding, i got stuck trying to improve the performance past a basic level and decided to learn to code efficiently.

Now as a Fullstack Academy student and a hacker I plan to dive deep into web dev and explore New York.

Until next time,
Evan
